Article.ArticleTitle: [Intracardiac echocardiography guiding structural heart disease interventions].

AbstractText: The impressive advances in structural heart disease interventions in the last decade led to renewed interest in intracardiac echocardiography (ICE). The potential of ICE to avoid transesophageal echocardiography with its known limits, has supported ICE technology progress and wider clinical use. This review summarizes relevant evidence about ICE and provides the structural interventionalist with an illustrative guide on the use of ICE to guide various structural heart interventions.
